document.full_text: women who smoke are much more likely than non-smokers to develop clogged arteries in the legs -- but quitting can lower those odds, according to a study published monday.
document.title: smokers show higher risk of leg artery disease
lines_and_colors: women who smoke are much more likely than non-smokers to develop clogged arteries in the legs -- but quitting can lower those odds, according to a study published monday.
